title: Tesla Optimus
description: Tesla Optimus is a humanoid robot designed to perform manual tasks, blending AI with robotics for future labor automation.
fullDescription: Tesla's Optimus (also known as the Tesla Bot) is a general-purpose humanoid robot under development by Tesla, Inc. It was unveiled by Elon Musk during Tesla's AI Day event in August 2021. Designed to handle tasks that are repetitive, dangerous, or boring for humans, Optimus aims to revolutionize industries by introducing an affordable, autonomous, and safe labor force. Built with Tesla's expertise in AI, autopilot hardware, and energy systems, the robot represents Tesla's ambition to extend its AI capabilities beyond vehicles.

specifications.Sensors: Autopilot cameras, FSD (Full Self-Driving) hardware, force feedback sensing, tactile sensors
specifications.Runtime: Designed for a full day of work on a single charge (claimed)

capabilities: Mobility: Walking at a moderate pace, navigating complex environments
Dexterity: Manipulating objects, using tools, picking up delicate or heavy items
Perception: Understanding its environment via cameras and sensors (similar to Tesla's vehicle perception stack)
Cognition: Basic decision-making, simple conversations, and task learning through demonstrations
Safety: Designed with lightweight materials and limited physical power to minimize risk to humans
applications: Industrial: Assisting in manufacturing, warehouse logistics, and material handling
Domestic: Performing household chores, running errands
Commercial: Serving in retail, restaurants, and customer service roles
Healthcare: Supporting elderly or disabled individuals with daily activities
Space and Exploration: Long-term potential to assist in extraterrestrial missions where human labor is costly and risky

title: NEO Gamma
description: NEO Gamma is a humanoid robot designed for home assistance, offering tasks like cleaning and companionship with advanced AI capabilities.
fullDescription: NEO Gamma is a next-generation humanoid robot developed by 1X Technologies, specifically designed for home environments. Standing approximately 1.65 meters tall and weighing around 30 kilograms, NEO Gamma integrates advanced AI to perform household tasks, engage in natural conversations, and provide companionship. Its design emphasizes safety and adaptability, featuring a soft knit suit and tendon-driven motion system for smooth, human-like movements.

specifications.Mobility: Natural human-like gait with the ability to squat, sit, and walk
specifications.Hands: Five-fingered hands capable of delicate object manipulation
specifications.Sensors: Visual sensors for object recognition and navigation
specifications.Audio System: Four microphones with beamforming and echo cancellation; three speakers for voice interaction and audio playback
specifications.AI Capabilities: Proprietary language model for natural conversation; reinforcement learning-based motion control
specifications.Safety Features: Soft knit suit and tendon-driven joints for safe interaction in home environments
specifications.Noise Level: Operates quietly, comparable to the noise level of a refrigerator

capabilities: Household Chores: Performs tidying, deep cleaning, and home management tasks
Natural Conversation: Engages in conversations and provides companionship using advanced language models
Adaptive Learning: Learns and adapts to new tasks through reinforcement learning
Object Manipulation: Delicate handling of household items with five-fingered hands
Quiet Operation: Minimal noise during operation for comfortable home environment
applications: Home Assistance: Cleaning, organizing, and managing household tasks
Companionship: Engaging in conversations, providing emotional support, and tutoring
Smart Home Integration: Potential to integrate with other smart home devices for enhanced automation
Elderly Care: Assistance with daily activities and social interaction
Educational Support: Tutoring and learning assistance for family members

videos.title: NEO Gamma - Home Assistant Robot Overview

sources.title: The Robot Report - NEO Gamma Better Fit for Home

title: CORLEO
description: CORLEO is a hydrogen-powered quadruped robot by Kawasaki, designed to revolutionize off-road transportation with AI and adaptive mobility.
fullDescription: CORLEO is an innovative quadruped robot developed by Kawasaki Heavy Industries, unveiled at the Osaka-Kansai Expo in April 2025. Combining Kawasaki's expertise in robotics and motorcycle engineering, CORLEO is designed as a rideable, hydrogen-powered robotic horse aimed at transforming off-road transportation. Its design draws inspiration from both horses and motorcycles, featuring four robotic legs with rubber hooves for terrain adaptability and a hydrogen-fueled engine that emits only water. While still in the conceptual phase, CORLEO showcases Kawasaki's vision for sustainable and intelligent mobility solutions.

specifications.Design: Quadruped structure resembling a robotic horse with motorcycle elements
specifications.Power Source: Hydrogen-fueled 150cc engine powering electric drive systems
specifications.Mobility: Four robotic legs with rubber hooves for navigating diverse terrains
specifications.AI Integration: Artificial intelligence for balance, coordination, and real-time adaptation to rider movements
specifications.User Interface: Dashboard display for critical riding data; night-vision road path projector
specifications.Capacity: Designed to carry up to two riders
specifications.Emissions: Zero harmful emissions - only water vapor
specifications.Terrain Capability: Grasslands, rocky areas, rubble fields, and complex off-road environments

capabilities: Terrain Navigation: Navigates complex terrains including grasslands, rocky areas, and rubble fields
Real-time Adaptation: Adjusts to rider's movements in real-time to maintain balance and stability
Eco-friendly Operation: Provides zero harmful emissions transportation with hydrogen power
Autonomous Navigation: Advanced sensors and AI for obstacle avoidance and path planning
Multi-rider Support: Designed to safely carry up to two riders simultaneously
applications: Transportation: Potential future alternative for off-road travel and exploration
Emergency Services: Could be adapted for search and rescue operations in challenging terrains
Recreational Use: Novel experience for adventure enthusiasts and tourists
Exhibitions and Demonstrations: Showcases advancements in robotics and sustainable transportation technologies
Military and Defense: Potential applications for reconnaissance and logistics in difficult terrain

title: Peanut
description: AI-powered cleaning robot designed for commercial spaces, operating autonomously with advanced navigation and disinfection capabilities.
fullDescription: Peanut is an advanced cleaning robot developed by Peanut Robotics, aimed at automating cleaning tasks in commercial environments such as hotels, offices, and stores. Utilizing transformer-based AI technology, Peanut navigates spaces independently, reaching difficult areas and operating continuously, except during charging periods. Its autonomous operation enhances efficiency and reduces the need for human intervention in routine cleaning tasks.

specifications.Navigation: Autonomous movement with advanced AI and transformer-based technology
specifications.Cleaning Mechanism: Equipped with specialized cloth for surface cleaning and disinfection
specifications.Disinfection: Utilizes EPA-rated chemicals with 99.999% efficacy against human coronaviruses
specifications.Operation Time: Continuous operation with periodic charging cycles
specifications.Data Collection: Environmental monitoring and data collection for ongoing improvements
specifications.Mobility: Wheeled base with omnidirectional movement capabilities
specifications.Interface: Touchscreen display for monitoring and control
specifications.Sensors: Advanced navigation sensors for obstacle detection and path planning

capabilities: Autonomous Cleaning: Performs independent cleaning in various commercial settings without human supervision
Advanced Navigation: Reaches tight and difficult areas using sophisticated AI pathfinding
Continuous Learning: Enhances cleaning processes through ongoing data collection and analysis
Disinfection: Provides medical-grade disinfection with EPA-rated chemical solutions
Adaptive Operation: Adjusts cleaning patterns based on space layout and usage patterns
applications: Hospitality: Hotels and resorts for automated room and common area cleaning
Corporate: Office buildings for routine maintenance and sanitization
Retail: Commercial outlets for floor cleaning and surface disinfection
Healthcare: Medical facilities for specialized cleaning and disinfection protocols
Education: Schools and universities for maintaining clean learning environments

title: YIGOLI Energy Arm
description: Robotic arm that automates vehicle refueling using advanced 3D imaging and AI for precise fuel cap handling.
fullDescription: The YIGOLI Energy Arm is an innovative robotic system designed to automate the vehicle refueling process. Utilizing 3D stereoscopic imaging and laser radar, it accurately identifies and opens fuel caps, inserts the nozzle, and refuels vehicles without human intervention. This cutting-edge technology enhances efficiency and safety at fueling stations while providing a seamless experience for drivers. The system represents a significant advancement in automotive service automation, combining precision robotics with intelligent recognition systems to revolutionize traditional gas station operations.

specifications.Imaging System: 3D stereoscopic imaging and laser radar for precise vehicle identification
specifications.Recognition Technology: Advanced AI algorithms for fuel cap identification and positioning
specifications.Precision: High-accuracy robotic arm with multiple degrees of freedom
specifications.Operation Mode: Fully automated refueling process without human intervention
specifications.Safety Features: Multiple safety sensors and emergency stop mechanisms
specifications.Compatibility: Designed to work with various vehicle types and fuel cap designs
specifications.Weather Resistance: All-weather operation capability for outdoor installations
specifications.Processing Speed: Real-time image processing and decision making

capabilities: Automated Fuel Cap Recognition: Uses 3D imaging to identify and locate fuel caps on various vehicle models
Precise Robotic Manipulation: Accurately opens fuel caps and inserts nozzles with mechanical precision
Intelligent Navigation: Advanced AI guidance system for optimal positioning and movement
Safety Monitoring: Continuous monitoring of the refueling process with automatic error detection
Vehicle Compatibility: Adapts to different vehicle heights, fuel cap positions, and access requirements
applications: Fueling Stations: Automating the refueling process for enhanced efficiency and reduced wait times
Fleet Management: Streamlining refueling operations for large vehicle fleets and logistics companies
Highway Service Centers: Providing automated fueling services for long-distance travelers
Commercial Depots: Automated refueling for delivery trucks, buses, and commercial vehicles
Smart Cities: Integration into intelligent transportation infrastructure for autonomous vehicle support

videos.title: YIGOLI Energy Arm - Automated Vehicle Refueling System

title: Suzuki MOQBA
description: Suzuki's MOQBA is a modular electric quadruped-wheeled vehicle that climbs stairs and adapts to chair, stand, or stretcher modes.
fullDescription: Unveiled at the Japan Mobility Show 2023, MOQBA is Suzuki's bold concept for next-generation urban mobility. It blends four electric wheels with robotic legs, enabling movement on flat surfaces and climbing stairs. Designed for accessibility, emergency response, and small-scale transport, this modular prototype can adjust its configuration for seated, standing, or stretcher use. The innovative design represents a paradigm shift in personal mobility, combining the efficiency of wheeled transport with the adaptability of legged robotics to navigate complex urban environments that traditional vehicles cannot access.

specifications.Architecture: Four robotic legs, each with 3 degrees of freedom, ending in electric wheels
specifications.Riding Modes: Chair Mode (seated driving), Standing Mode (upright control), Stretcher Mode (patient transport)
specifications.Mobility: Legs compress and extend to adapt to terrain, with speed bumps and stairs traversal via leg articulation
specifications.Range: Up to 80 km (50 miles) per charge
specifications.Modularity: Interchangeable attachments include wheelchair, cargo basket, robotic arm, or stretcher
specifications.Terrain Capability: Flat surfaces, stairs, curbs, and various urban obstacles
specifications.Power Source: Electric battery system with regenerative capabilities

capabilities: Stair-climbing: Ascends and descends steps one leg at a time while keeping passengers level
Versatile configurations: Transitions smoothly between chair, stand, stretcher, or cargo use
Enhanced accessibility: Tailored for elderly, disabled, emergency services, or deliveries in complex urban environments
Adaptive terrain navigation: Automatically adjusts leg positioning and wheel configuration based on surface conditions
Modular functionality: Quick-change system for different operational modes and attachments
applications: Urban commuting & Last-mile travel: Ideal for navigating curbs and staircases in cities
Accessibility mobility: Empowers those with limited mobility to reclaim independence
Emergency response: Quickly transport patients or supplies in challenging environments
Light logistics: Carries goods, groceries, or refuse through built-up areas
Healthcare support: Mobile assistance platform for medical facilities and home care

videos.title: Suzuki MOQBA - Stair-Climbing Electric Mobility Concept

sources.title: Captain Electro - Suzuki's Stair-Climbing Electric Marvel

title: Kubota KATR
description: Kubota's KATR is a compact, hydraulically legged all-terrain robot offering stable cargo transport across slopes and rugged environments.
fullDescription: Developed by Kubota Corporation, KATR (Kubota All-Terrain Robot) is a four-wheeled robotic platform with hydraulically actuated legs that adjust in real-time to maintain a level cargo deck on uneven terrain. Launched in 2024, it received the CES® 2025 Innovation Awards' 'Best of Innovation' in Industrial Equipment & Machinery. Designed for agriculture, construction, forestry, and disaster relief, it excels in areas where traditional machinery struggles. The innovative design combines the stability of tracked vehicles with the agility of legged robots, making it perfect for precision farming and challenging terrain operations.

specifications.Wheel & Leg System: Dual-wheel per leg; hydraulic legs adjust to terrain to keep the deck level
specifications.Powertrain: Available with either combustion engine or electric drive (electric variant in development)
specifications.Size & Compactness: Small enough to fit into a light pickup truck bed or commercial minivan
specifications.Control Modes: Operable via onboard controller or remote control
specifications.Stability System: Proprietary real-time algorithm and sensor suite dynamically maintain level cargo platform on slopes
specifications.Steering: Pivot-turn capability enables operation in tight spaces
specifications.Terrain Capability: Handles slopes, uneven ground, and challenging agricultural environments

capabilities: Level Cargo Deck: Hydraulic leg adjustments handle slopes and uneven ground seamlessly
Robust Multi-Terrain Mobility: Four-wheel drive, each on independent hydraulic legs, allow traversing rugged off-road environments
Versatile Deployment: Supports agriculture, forestry, construction, and disaster relief operations
Modular Platform: Cargo deck can carry tools, sensors, or even serve as a working platform
Flexible Power Options: Users can choose combustion or full-electric variant to match use case and sustainability goals
applications: Agriculture: Especially effective in hilly or terraced farms, orchards, and vineyards; modular attachments (sprayers, sensors) aid in precision farming
Construction & Forestry: Transport materials and operate equipment on steep, uneven terrain
Disaster Response: Delivers supplies over rubble or landslide-affected areas where wheeled vehicles struggle
Research & Development: Acts as a scalable platform for experimenting with attachments (e.g., pruners, imagers, robotic arms)
Vineyard Operations: Perfect for navigating between vine rows and carrying harvesting equipment on slopes

sources.title: Farm Progress - Kubota Robots Bring Versatility to the Vineyard
